intro: Mecranium tricostatum, commonly known as the three-costed mecranium, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Malvaceae. It is characterized by its distinctive three-lobed leaves and showy, pentagonal flowers that typically bloom in shades of pink or purple. The plant is native to tropical regions of South America and thrives in humid, shaded environments. It has a fibrous root system and produces capsule fruits that contain numerous small seeds. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in botanical gardens and as a houseplant.
